title: Ticket #1375: reuse shadow processes
description:
When operating at high frequency, the schedd spends something like 1/3 of its time creating shadows. There is additional overhead managing security sessions for the new processes, receiving an initial heartbeat message, and so on. There is additional overhead to the rest of the system as each new shadow parses the configuration file and initializes DaemonCore.

If the shadow processes were reused for running multiple jobs this overhead would be reduced. In some tests I have done, this allows the schedd to run jobs at roughly twice the rate.
remarks:
2010-Apr-23 17:44:36 by danb:
Added SHADOW_WORKLIFE, which is the time in seconds after which the shadow will not try to fetch additional jobs. The default 0 gives the previous behavior of running one job per shadow.

2010-May-03 11:45:13 by tstclair:
During the end of the run we see a huge spike in errors on the startd's, when running 60 second sleep jobs. They characteristically look like the following:

startd:

04/29 23:11:09 attempt to connect to <172.17.1.7:36996> failed: Connection refused (connect errno = 111).

04/29 23:11:09 DC_AUTHENTICATE: attempt to open invalid session pman07:10361:1272596978:551, failing.

04/29 23:11:09 Failed to send DC_INVALIDATE_KEY to daemon at <172.17.1.7:36996>: SECMAN:2003:TCP connection to daemon at <172.17.1.7:36996> failed.

04/29 23:11:09 attempt to connect to <172.17.1.7:42975> failed: Connection refused (connect errno = 111).

04/29 23:11:09 DC_AUTHENTICATE: attempt to open invalid session pman07:10361:1272596983:552, failing.

04/29 23:11:09 Failed to send DC_INVALIDATE_KEY to daemon at <172.17.1.7:42975>: SECMAN:2003:TCP connection to daemon at <172.17.1.7:42975> failed.

<repeat N-slots>

However we do not see this when running 4 minute sleep jobs, and we did not see this prior to the patch.

2010-May-04 11:00:23 by danb:
Regarding the 'invalid session' errors in the startd logs: can you confirm that these invalid session requests are originated by the starters? When the startd tries to send a message to the daemon that generated the request, it fails to connect to the daemon's address with a message like this: 

04/29 22:17:35 Failed to send DC_INVALIDATE_KEY to daemon at <172.17.1.7:41113>: SECMAN:2003:TCP connection to daemon at <172.17.1.7:41113> failed.

Does the IP:port number mentioned in this message match up with the starter address? The starter's address should be logged in the starter log with a message similar to this: 

04/29 22:09:32 DaemonCore: Command Socket at <172.17.1.7:40700>

2010-May-04 11:17:04 by tstclair:
Yes it matches with the starter address.

We also recently found that if we disable MAX_ACCEPT across the pool you eliminate this issue, so it may not be directly related with this patch. I still find it to be unusual.

We are in the process of setting it only on the schedd to see what affects it has. I will keep you posted.
